body.name: alfd suoke Ergonomic CPU Holder Under Desk Mount, PC Stand Holds 5.23in-8.85in Wide, Computer Tower Holder 360° Swivel Height & Width Adjustable, Supports up to 66 lbs, Black

features: 360 Degree Swivel: Easy to get quick access to backside port and power cord, keep the PC tower & fan cool. If you own a gaming case with RGB lights, you can enjoy light atmosphere from all angles.

Under Desk Mount CPU Holder: Conveniently mounts your PC holder under a desk, so you can free up space for a more comfortable sitting position and posture. The PC tower stand suspends your CPU above the ground, protecting it from getting bumped and dusty or moisture.

Adjustable CPU Mount: Universal computer tower fits most PC cases with adjustable width from 5.2" - 8.8" and adjustable height from3.9 to 18.8" with more adjustable range than others. Supports weights up to 66 lbs.

Heavy Duty PC Stand: Under desk PC mount and hardware parts are made from cold rolled carbon steel. Features thick padding bars to protect your PC case from scratches. Rest assured your computer case is in safe hands.

Easy to Install: The computer tower stand comes with required tools and instructions. 3 self-tapping screws are small enough to secure desktop, making it able to attach to most any desktop made of wood, MDF or another similar material.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Footrest stool Massaging foot rest 31.5in desk extender 29in mounted keyboard extender 25in keyboard extender Function Office/Home footrest stool Two sided massage footrest Used as desk extender, or keyboard extender Used as mounted keyboard extender, or as arm rest Used as keyboard extender, or as arm rest

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Makes for a tidy desk area
reviews.reviewText: I really like this item. It took an little while to assemble, but it was well worth it. The top bracket secures snuggly to the underside of my desk, while the rest hangs below, out of my way and OFF OF THE GROUND!! It does allow the CPU to swivel around, but not in my setup since the legs of my desk are too close together. I'm not sure why I would want it to swivel anyways. The overall construction is super solid with nicely welded joints. I have high confidence in it lasting for years and years. Besides making my desk area look a lot better, it also helps by keeping the computer out of the way when it's time to vacuum. This is an excellent computer holder. In am well pleased.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars This thing sucks.
reviews.reviewText: Small things first, the screws aren’t black like in the picture. Whatever.This thing is supposed to let your pc conveniently spIn around.. okay, sure, BUT there’s nothing to tighten so that it DOESN’T SPIN when you don’t want it to and if you want to secure your expensive PC into its new merry-go-round there’s this screw you have to tighten DIRECTLY into the top of your PC (see photo)Also there were no directions whatsoever and came in many parts.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works well with a couple of caveats
reviews.reviewText: IMMEDIATE WARNING- be careful which desktop you use- it needs a solid core- I used a certain Swedish meatball restaurant that sells furniture tabletop and the screws began to rip out of the hollow core. You can solve this problem by gluing a ¼ in piece of wood to the location and screwing into it. I have another issue with the design unfortunately- the top holder piece screw pokes thru and will scrape the top of your desktop if you don’t put a felt pad there. Curiously my kit did not come with instructions, please note the pictures on the listing or my review if you need assistance. If you use the included wood screws for the mount- you are going to be much more limited on weight tolerance than I think you need to- they were only about 1/4in wood screws- I'd recommend a 1in thick desktop with half in screws for much higher weight tolerances (IE a gamer rig).Aside from these negatives, the piece is as solid as your desk that is holding it. I think it is a convenient way of mounting the PC. I opted to use the top screw holes but it is worth noting you can also side (or wall) mount the unit. In either case I'd consider weight limits, if you are mounting an extremely top end graphics card and power supply in a larger case, you may need to use a more solid mounting option than the included screws- at that point I'd consider pass thru bolts and nuts and sink the screws flush.It's imperfect out of box, but a little bit of work makes it useful mount- get the felt pad, and make sure your mounting is solid enough to hold the weight- which probably means opting for bigger screws than the included quarter in wood screws.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It cleared off more room off my desk
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to get a better solution for placing my computer. It did take up a corner of my work desk, so having this rack attach to the underside of my desk was the perfect solution. This gives me more room to write and keep some of my paperwork near me and my computer is still close enough where the cords are not stretched as much as possible. It does swivel, but I have it pretty stationary and have no intention of moving it, outside of servicing it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Stay away from this
reviews.reviewText: No instructions included.Wrong item shown in 20-second assembly video on the listing.No way to stop rotation.Shoddy construction.Loose screws to scrape away at your tower if you set it in here.Included hardware is woefully inadequate in mounting.Like the other reviewer said, this is a heaping piece of junk, and a liability.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy yo install, holds computer securely, overall very happy for the extra desk space.
reviews.reviewText: I was able to install it quickly and easily, seems to be quite secure and hold my desktop computer securely. Might be nice if they added a securing screw to stop it from rotating around the center pole, but as it's near the legs of my desk it doesn't matter for my setup. Overall would recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great for height adjustable desks and mobile workstations
reviews.reviewText: This review is for the alfd suoke Ergonomic CPU Holder Under Desk Mount.I ordered this to hold my PC tower under my mobile workstation setup.The build quality is ok. The weight bearing components are metal while the two sleeve parts that slide onto the arm are made of plastic.On my unit, the paint or finish on the base part has some kind of stain or to much paint. I didn't bother to do anything about it because it was going to be covered by my computer and it didn't affect functionality.The top sleeve with the width adjustment bracket does not have a locking bolt for the height. If you try to remove your computer, you'll have to hold the bracket up or loosen it and swing the bracket out of the way, otherwise it will just drop down.In the product installation video, it shows four screws for the top mount. My unit only has 3 screws/holes at the top. It did not affect the support of my PC but may affect heavier computers or "gaming" computers. As a side note, you will have to watch the video for assembly because there were no instructions included.For reference, I have a standard mid tower (attached pictures) with a standard ATX motherboard, CPU, regular air cooler, and power supply. No hard drives, glass panels, or water cooling, so my PC is fairly light weight.Installation and assembly is easy. Just make sure you visualize and plan for your tower computer and the space it takes up. I did use an impact driver for the screws.In my installation, my tower gets in the way of leg room so I may have to use a smaller build.In summary I did not encounter any major issues with the product itself and the alfd suoke Ergonomic CPU Holder does the job if you have a standard mid-tower computer tower or smaller, and would like to relocate the tower under your desk but off the ground. I would highly recommend it for a workstation style desk setup or rising desk because the computer will move with the desk and you don't have to worry about cable lengths.I did deduct a star because it did not include basic printed instructions.
